Tom,
 
Steve said that the katana would have a groove on the saya that would hold
it tight against the bevel on the wakizashi so that the two would almost
lock together. He said the bevel is fairly common on daisho wak saya's.
 
Peter
 
 
  _____  

From: Tom Helm [mailto:junkmail@...] 
Sent: 18 April 2004 02:36
To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [nihontostudy] Wakizashi Help
 
Peter-
      Does Steve suggest how the "bevel" helps situate the wakizashi when in

the belt? I could understand a bevel on the katana which is above and 
outside the Wakizashi in the belt but don't see it's purpose on the 
shoto...
-t
